NAME: Thiopental Sodium
CIMS CLASS: Possible increase in difficulty in producing anaesthesia in patients taking alcohol or CNS depressants. Additive action with other CNS depressants including sedatives| hypnotics| nitrous oxide or alcohol. Increased hypotension and excitatory effects with phenothiazine antipsychotics. Increased hypnotic effect with antipsychotic. Decreased requirement of thiopental sodium with metoclopramide| sulfisoxazole| aspirin| meprobamate| probenecid and other highly protein bound drugs.
